entry.title: java编程思想 第四版 第九章 练习1-19(个人练习)
entry.content:
###第九章 练习1

public class Test93 {
public static void main(String[] args) {
Rodent4[] rodents = {new Mouse4(),new Gerbil4(),new Hamster4()};
for (Rodent4 r : rodents){
r.universal();
System.out.println(r);
}
}
}

abstract class Rodent4{
public abstract void universal();
}

class Mouse4 extends Rodent4{
public void universal(){
System.out.println(“Mouse4.method”);
}

@Override
public String toString() {
    return "Mouse4";
}

}
class Gerbil4 extends Rodent4{
public void universal(){
System.out.println(“Gerbil4.method”);
}
@Override
public String toString() {
return “Gerbil4”;
}
}
class Hamster4 extends Rodent4{
public void universal(){
System.out.println(“Hamster4.method”);
}
@Override
public String toString() {
return “Hamster4”;
}
}

    ###第九章 练习2

abstract class T{
void t(){
    System.out.println("T.t()");

}

}
public class Test94 {
public static void main(String[] args) {
//T t = new T();
}
}

###第九章 练习3

abstract class Print{
Print(){
print();
}
public abstract void print();
}
class Print1 extends Print{
private int i = 5;
public void print(){
System.out.println(“Print1.print() 整形变量的值: “ + “ “ + i);
}
}
public class Test95 {
public static void main(String[] args) {
new Print1().print();
}
}

###第九章 练习4

public class Test96 {
public static void getMethod(Abs abs) {
    ((Abs2) abs).abs2();
}

public static void getMethod2(Abs3 abs) {
    abs.abs3();
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
    Test96.getMethod(new Abs2());
    Test96.getMethod2(new Abs4());
}

}

abstract class Abs {
//public abstract void getMethod();
}

class Abs2 extends Abs {
public void abs2() {
System.out.println(“Abs2.abs2()..”);
}

}

abstract class Abs3 {
abstract public void abs3();
}

class Abs4 extends Abs3 {
@Override
public void abs3() {
System.out.println(“Abs4.abs3()”);
}
}

###第九章 练习5
    --答案略过

###第九章 练习6
    --答案略过

###第九章 练习7

public class Test99 {

/*@Override
public void Mouse() {
    System.out.println("老鼠");
}

@Override
public void Gerbil() {
    System.out.println("Ger 鼠");
}

@Override
public void Hamster() {
    System.out.println("大➕鼠");
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
    Test99 test99 = new Test99();
    test99.Gerbil();
    test99.Hamster();
    test99.Mouse();

}*/
public static void main(String[] args) {
    Rodent10[] rodents = {new Mouse10(),new Gerbil10(),new Hamster10()};
    for (Rodent10 r : rodents){
        r.universal();
    }
}

}

interface Rodent10{
void universal();
}

class Mouse10 implements Rodent10{
public void universal(){
System.out.println(“Mouse10.method”);
}
}
class Gerbil10 implements Rodent10{
public void universal(){
System.out.println(“Gerbil10.method”);
}
}
class Hamster10 implements Rodent10{
public void universal(){
System.out.println(“Hamster10.method”);
}
}

###第九章 练习8

public class Test100 {
public static void main(String[] args) {
(new FastFoodImpl()).One1();
}
}

interface FastFood{
void One1();
}
class FastFoodImpl implements FastFood{

@Override
public void One1() {
    System.out.println("FastFoodImpl.One1()");
}

}

###第九章 练习9

enum Note{
MIDDLE_C, C_SHARP, B_FLAT

}
interface Instrument {

int VALUE = 5;

void adjust();

}

interface Playable {
void play(Note n);
}

abstract class Common {
public abstract void play(Note n);

public abstract void adjust();

}

class Wind implements Instrument, Playable {

/* public void play(Note n) { System.out.println("Wind.play() " + n); }*/
public String toString() {
    return "Wind";
}

@Override
public void adjust() {
    System.out.println("Adjusting Wind");
}

@Override
public void play(Note n) {
    System.out.println("Windinterface.play() " + n);
}

}

class Percussion implements Instrument, Playable {
/* @Override
public void play(Note n) { System.out.println(“Percussion.play() “ + n); }*/
public String toString() {
return “Percussion”;
}

@Override
public void adjust() {
    System.out.println("Adjusting Percussion");
}

@Override
public void play(Note n) {
    System.out.println("Percussioninterface.play() " + n);
}

}

class Stringed implements Instrument, Playable {
/@Override
public void play(Note n) { System.out.println(“Stringed.play() “ + n); }/
public String toString() {
return “Stringed”;
}

@Override
public void adjust() {
    System.out.println("Adjusting Stringed");
}

@Override
public void play(Note n) {
    System.out.println("Stringedinterface.play() " + n);
}

}

class Brass extends Wind {
@Override
public void play(Note n) {
System.out.println(“Brass.play() “ + n);
}

public void adjust() {
    System.out.println("Adjusting Brass");
}

}

class Woodwind extends Wind {
@Override
public void play(Note n) {
System.out.println(“Woodwind.play() “ + n);
}

public String toString() {
    return "Woodwind";
}

}

public class Test101 {
// Doesn’t care about type, so new types
// added to the system still work right:
public static void tune(Playable p) {
// …
p.play(Note.MIDDLE_C);
}

public static void tuneAll(Playable[] e) {
    for (Playable i : e) {
         tune(i);
        System.out.println(i);
    }

}

public static void main(String[] args) {
    // Upcasting during addition to the array:
    Playable[] playable = {
            new Wind(),
            new Percussion(),
            new Stringed(),
            // new Brass(),
            //new Woodwind()
    };
    tuneAll(playable);


}

}

###第九章 练习10

enum Note{
MIDDLE_C, C_SHARP, B_FLAT

}

interface Instrument{
int VALUE = 5;
void play(Note n);
void adjust();
}
abstract class Common{
public abstract void play(Note n);
public abstract void adjust();
}

class Wind implements Instrument {
@Override
public void play(Note n) { System.out.println(“Wind.play() “ + n); }
public String toString() {
return “Wind”;
}
@Override
public void adjust() { System.out.println(“Adjusting Wind”); }
}

class Percussion implements Instrument {
@Override
public void play(Note n) { System.out.println(“Percussion.play() “ + n); }
public String toString() {
return “Percussion”;
}
@Override
public void adjust() { System.out.println(“Adjusting Percussion”); }
}

class Stringed implements Instrument {
@Override
public void play(Note n) { System.out.println(“Stringed.play() “ + n); }
public String toString() {
return “Stringed”;
}
@Override
public void adjust() { System.out.println(“Adjusting Stringed”); }
}

class Brass extends Wind {
@Override
public void play(Note n) { System.out.println(“Brass.play() “ + n); }
public void adjust() { System.out.println(“Adjusting Brass”); }
}

class Woodwind extends Wind {
@Override
public void play(Note n) {System.out.println(“Woodwind.play() “ + n); }

public String toString() {
    return "Woodwind";
}

}

public class Test102 {
// Doesn’t care about type, so new types
// added to the system still work right:
public static void tune(Instrument i) {
// …
i.play(Note.MIDDLE_C);
}

public static void tuneAll(Instrument[] e) {
    for (Instrument i : e) {
        // tune(i);
        System.out.println(i.toString());
    }

}

public static void main(String[] args) {
    // Upcasting during addition to the array:
    Instrument[] orchestra = {
            new Wind(),
            new Percussion(),
            new Stringed(),
            // new Brass(),
            //new Woodwind()
    };
    tuneAll(orchestra);

}

}

###第九章 练习11

interface Processor{
String name();
Object process(Object input);
}
class Class{
public static void process(Processor p, Object s){
System.out.println(“using Processor” + p.name());
System.out.println(p.process(s));
}
}
class charterPaidSwapper{
static String swapper(String s){
StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(s);
for (int i = 0; i < sb.length()-1; i+=2) {
char c1 = sb.charAt(i);
char c2 = sb.charAt(i + 1);
sb.setCharAt(i,c2);
sb.setCharAt(i+1,c1);
}
return sb.toString();
}
}

class charAdapter implements Processor{

@Override
public String name() {
    return getClass().getSimpleName();
}

@Override
public Object process(Object input) {
    return charterPaidSwapper.swapper((String)input);
}

}
public class Test103 {
public static void main(String[] args) {
Class.process(new charAdapter(),”ABCDE”);
Class.process(new charAdapter(),”12345”);
}
}

###第九章  练习12

interface CanClimb{
void Climb();
}
interface CanFight{
void Fight();
}
interface CanSwim{
void swim();
}
interface CanFly{
void fly();
}
class ActionCharactor{
public void Fight(){}
}

class Hero extends ActionCharactor implements CanClimb,CanFight,CanSwim,CanFly{

@Override
public void Climb() {
    System.out.println("Hero.Climb()");
}

@Override
public void swim() {

}

@Override
public void fly() {

}

}
public class Test104 {
public static void c(CanClimb cc){cc.Climb();}
public static void f(CanFight cc){cc.Fight();}
public static void cs(CanSwim cc){cc.swim();}
public static void cf(CanFly cc){cc.fly();}
public static void a(ActionCharactor cc){cc.Fight();}

public static void main(String[] args) {
    Hero hero = new Hero();
    c(hero);
    f(hero);
    cs(hero);
    cf(hero);
    a(hero);
}

}
###第九章 练习13

interface One1{
void method1();
}
interface One2 extends One1{
void method1();
}
interface One3 extends One1{
void method1();
}
interface One4 extends One2,One3{

}
public class Test105 implements One4 {

@Override
public void method1() {
    System.out.println(this + "  " + "method1()");
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
    Test105 test105 = new Test105();
    test105.method1();
}

}

###第九章  练习14

interface Monster {
void Method1();

void Method2();

}

interface Jinjin {
void Method3();

void Method4();

}

interface Yiyi {
void Method5();

void Method6();

}

interface Renren extends Monster, Jinjin, Yiyi {
void Method7();
}

class Class1 {

}

class Class2 extends Class1 {
Renren renren = new Renren() {
@Override
public void Method7() {

    }

    @Override
    public void Method5() {

    }

    @Override
    public void Method6() {

    }

    @Override
    public void Method3() {

    }

    @Override
    public void Method4() {

    }

    @Override
    public void Method1() {

    }

    @Override
    public void Method2() {

    }
};

}

class Clacc {
public static void M(Object m) {

}

public static void J(Object j) {

}

public static void Y(Object y) {
}

public static void R(Object r) {

}

}

public class Test106 {
public static void main(String[] args) {
Class2 class2 = new Class2();
Clacc.M(class2);
Clacc.J(class2);
Clacc.R(class2);
Clacc.Y(class2);
}
}

###第九章  练习15

interface Monster2 {
void Method1();

void Method2();

}

interface Jinjin2 {
void Method3();

void Method4();

}

interface Yiyi2 {
void Method5();

void Method6();

}

interface Renren2 extends Monster2, Jinjin2, Yiyi2 {
void Method7();
}

class Class3 {

}

class Class4 extends Class2 {
Renren renren = new Renren() {
@Override
public void Method7() {

    }

    @Override
    public void Method5() {

    }

    @Override
    public void Method6() {

    }

    @Override
    public void Method3() {

    }

    @Override
    public void Method4() {

    }

    @Override
    public void Method1() {

    }

    @Override
    public void Method2() {

    }
};

}

class Clacc2 {
public static void M(Object m) {

}

public static void J(Object j) {

}

public static void Y(Object y) {
}

public static void R(Object r) {

}

}

abstract class ATTClass{
abstract void att();
}
public class Test107 extends ATTClass {
@Override
void att() {
System.out.println(“Test107.att()”);
}
public static void main(String[] args) {
Class4 class4 = new Class4();
Clacc.M(class4);
Clacc.J(class4);
Clacc.R(class4);
Clacc.Y(class4);
new Test107().att();

}

}

entry.title: Java编程思想第四版(Interfaces )----第9章课后练习1-19(个人练习)
entry.content:
#第九章 练习1

public class Test93 {
public static void main(String[] args) {
Rodent4[] rodents = {new Mouse4(),new Gerbil4(),new Hamster4()};
for (Rodent4 r : rodents){
r.universal();
System.out.println(r);
}
}
}

abstract class Rodent4{
public abstract void universal();
}

class Mouse4 extends Rodent4{
public void universal(){
System.out.println(“Mouse4.method”);
}

@Override
public String toString() {
    return "Mouse4";
}

}
class Gerbil4 extends Rodent4{
public void universal(){
System.out.println(“Gerbil4.method”);
}
@Override
public String toString() {
return “Gerbil4”;
}
}
class Hamster4 extends Rodent4{

}
@Override

return “Hamster4”;

###第九章 练习9

enum Note{

}

void adjust();

interface Playable {

}

abstract class Common {

class Wind implements Instrument, Playable {

/* public void play(Note n) { System.out.println("Wind.play() " + n); }*/

/* @Override

public class Test101 {
// Doesn’t care about type, so new types
// added to the system still work right:
public static void tune(Playable p) {
// …
p.play(Note.MIDDLE_C);
}

public static void tuneAll(Playable[] e) {
    for (Playable i : e) {
         tune(i);
        System.out.println(i);
    }

}

public static void main(String[] args) {
    // Upcasting during addition to the array:
    Playable[] playable = {
            new Wind(),
            new Percussion(),
            new Stringed(),
            // new Brass(),
            //new Woodwind()
    };
    tuneAll(playable);


}

}

###第九章 练习11

interface Processor{
String name();
Object process(Object input);
}
class Class{
public static void process(Processor p, Object s){
System.out.println(“using Processor” + p.name());
System.out.println(p.process(s));
}
}
class charterPaidSwapper{
static String swapper(String s){
StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder(s);
for (int i = 0; i < sb.length()-1; i+=2) {
char c1 = sb.charAt(i);
char c2 = sb.charAt(i + 1);
sb.setCharAt(i,c2);
sb.setCharAt(i+1,c1);
}
return sb.toString();
}
}

class charAdapter implements Processor{

@Override
public String name() {
    return getClass().getSimpleName();
}

@Override
public Object process(Object input) {
    return charterPaidSwapper.swapper((String)input);
}

}
public class Test103 {
public static void main(String[] args) {
Class.process(new charAdapter(),”ABCDE”);
Class.process(new charAdapter(),”12345”);
}
}

###第九章  练习12

interface CanClimb{
void Climb();
}
interface CanFight{
void Fight();
}
interface CanSwim{
void swim();
}
interface CanFly{
void fly();
}
class ActionCharactor{
public void Fight(){}
}

class Hero extends ActionCharactor implements CanClimb,CanFight,CanSwim,CanFly{

@Override
public void Climb() {
    System.out.println("Hero.Climb()");
}

@Override
public void swim() {

}

@Override
public void fly() {

}

}
public class Test104 {
public static void c(CanClimb cc){cc.Climb();}
public static void f(CanFight cc){cc.Fight();}
public static void cs(CanSwim cc){cc.swim();}
public static void cf(CanFly cc){cc.fly();}
public static void a(ActionCharactor cc){cc.Fight();}

public static void main(String[] args) {
    Hero hero = new Hero();
    c(hero);
    f(hero);
    cs(hero);
    cf(hero);
    a(hero);
}

}
###第九章 练习13

interface One1{
void method1();
}
interface One2 extends One1{
void method1();
}
interface One3 extends One1{
void method1();
}
interface One4 extends One2,One3{

}
public class Test105 implements One4 {

@Override
public void method1() {
    System.out.println(this + "  " + "method1()");
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
    Test105 test105 = new Test105();
    test105.method1();
}

}

###第九章  练习14

void Method1();

void Method2();

}

void Method4();

}

void Method6();

}

interface Renren extends Monster, Jinjin, Yiyi {

}

class Class1 {

}

Renren renren = new Renren() {
@Override
public void Method7() {

    }

    @Override
    public void Method5() {

    }

    @Override
    public void Method6() {

    }

    @Override
    public void Method3() {

    }

    @Override
    public void Method4() {

    }

    @Override

    }

    @Override
    public void Method2() {

    }
};

}

class Clacc {
public static void M(Object m) {

}

public static void J(Object j) {

}

public static void Y(Object y) {
}

public static void R(Object r) {

}

}

Class2 class2 = new Class2();
Clacc.M(class2);
Clacc.J(class2);
Clacc.R(class2);
Clacc.Y(class2);
}
}

}

abstract class ATTClass{
abstract void att();
}
public class Test107 extends ATTClass {
@Override
void att() {
System.out.println(“Test107.att()”);
}
public static void main(String[] args) {

#练习18

/** * java编程思想第九章 练习18 */
interface Cycle10{
void method1();
}
interface Cycle10Factory{
Cycle10 getCycle10();
}
class Unicycle10 implements Cycle10{

@Override
public void method1() {
    System.out.println("Unicycle10.method1()");
}

}

class Unicycle10Factory implements Cycle10Factory{

@Override
public Cycle10 getCycle10() {
    return new Unicycle10();
}

}

class Bicycle10 implements Cycle10{

@Override
public void method1() {
    System.out.println("Bicycle10.method1()");
}

}

class Bicycle10Factory implements Cycle10Factory{

@Override
public Cycle10 getCycle10() {
    return new Bicycle10();
}

}
class Tricycle10 implements Cycle10{

@Override
public void method1() {
    System.out.println("Tricycle10.method1()");
}

}
class Tricycle10Factory implements Cycle10Factory{

@Override
public Cycle10 getCycle10() {
    return new Tricycle10();
}

}
public class Test110 {
public static void Test1(Unicycle10Factory unicycle10Factory) {
Cycle10 cycle10 = unicycle10Factory.getCycle10();
cycle10.method1();
}

public static void Test2(Bicycle10Factory bicycle10Factory) {
    Cycle10 cycle10 = bicycle10Factory.getCycle10();
    cycle10.method1();
}

public static void Test3(Tricycle10Factory tricycle10Factory) {
    Cycle10 cycle10 = tricycle10Factory.getCycle10();
    cycle10.method1();
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
    Test1(new Unicycle10Factory());
    Test2(new Bicycle10Factory());
    Test3(new Tricycle10Factory());


}

}

#练习19

/**

  • java编程思想第九章 练习19
  • /

public class Test111 {
public static ThrowImpl ThrowFileFactory1(){
return new ThrowImpl().getThrow();
}
public static FilpImpl ThrowFileFactory2(){
return (FilpImpl) new FilpImpl().getfilp();
}

public static void main(String[] args) {
   ThrowFileFactory1();
   ThrowFileFactory2();
}

}
interface Throw{
ThrowImpl getThrow();
}

interface Filp{
Filp getfilp();
}
class ThrowImpl implements Throw{

@Override
public ThrowImpl getThrow() {
    System.out.println("工厂方法实现了抛硬币功能");
    return new ThrowImpl();
}

}

class FilpImpl implements Filp{
@Override
public Filp getfilp() {
System.out.println(“工厂方法执行了掷筛子功能”);
return new FilpImpl();
}
}

entry.title: 这是我的第一篇博客文章
entry.content:
##一 1.这是我的第一篇博客文章
        今天第一天注册个人博客,到来的朋友我们可以一起学习进步！
        哈哈!

        --
